awd_titl_txt: RIA:  Multivariate Decision Trees via Optimization
awd_abstract_narration: 9409427  Bennett       This research examines multivariate decision tree induction as  a mathematical program solved in serial or parallel.  Depending on  the splitting criterion or objective function minimized, the  problem of constructing each decision node in the tree is a linear,  piecewise-quadratic, bilinear, or multilinear program.  Unlike  previous perceptron-type and randomized algorithms, the proposed  mathematical programs exactly characterize an optimal solution of  the decision node problem.  A new splitting criterion, subtree  optimization, is proposed.  Subtree optimization differs from  previous greedy decision tree algorithms in that it explicitly  considers all subsequent decisions when constructing the current  decision node.  Subtree optimization can be used to generate a  globally optimal tree with a fixed topology.  The goals of this  work are to create better decision tree algorithms, gain a better  mathematical understanding of the bias of splitting criteria,  develop new mathematical programming theory and techniques for  solving these problems, and implement and test these algorithms on  serial and parallel computers.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
